algorithm_technique: Iterate through the string, increment count when a non-space character follows a space or is at the beginning.
Split the string by spaces and filter out empty strings.
problem_summary_simple: Count the number of contiguous sequences of non-space characters in a string.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through the string, identifying segments by detecting transitions from space to non-space characters or the start of the string.
key_insights: A segment is defined by a sequence of non-space characters.
The start of a segment can be identified by a non-space character that is either at the beginning of the string or follows a space.
The provided solution `countSegments` uses a single pass and constant extra space, while `countSegments2` leverages built-in string methods for conciseness.
